11121.content:
Aeris sat on the grimey street somewhere deep in Midgar. Her tattered pink dress lay fluffed out around her legs. The basket of flowers she had been trying to sell lay tipped next to her, and her head hung low as shift workers wandered past from the many factories of the industrial city.

Suddenly, something warm flashed against the side of her face. Rasing her head her brilliant green eyes fluttered open. Turning around and supporting herself on hands and knees she stared at a crack in the wall. Sparks popped from the opening, a bright neon emerald glow. She padded a soft hand against the rough cement wall and tilted her head, leaning closer to peer inside.

Images began to flood through Aeris mind, horrible visions leading up to her own demise by a man in a black trench coat. His long sword plunging unseen from behind until...

The images stopped. Shaken, Aeris backed up and turned to flop down again against the building. She gasped, finding the same man from the visions standing before her. The huge blade of his sword was pointed right at her, and in his free hand, he held an odd glowing orb of materia. His piercing eyes glared down upon her.

"It doesn't have to be like that." The dark figure in the trench coat said, wavering slightly and putting his sword down to the cobblestone road, long white hair waving with his movements.

Aeris, "How did you know?" A smile played across the mans lips. "What was that? The future?"

He slowly nodded, "We Ancients can bring a new era to this world. However, we need to return all life to the life stream first. I know you understand me. You know it is for the best. I am Sephiroth, and you shall be the instrument of this planets destruction."

"Me? I'm just a flower girl. How can I do such a thing? Why would I help you anyway?" Aeris was looking around, talking loudly and hoping one of the workers would stop. Not even the soldiers cared, in fact, they seemed to be hurrying people out of the district. Her heart began to beat faster.

Sephiroth shook his head, "Do you want that future? Do you want me to be your end? This is the best way. The planet will not be harmed, only the life that should be cleansed from its surface."

She bowed her head. What could a simple flower girl do? Rising, her soft leather padded boots tapped lightly upon the road. "What do I do?"

Sephiroth sheathed his sword and held out the strange materia in both hands. In flashed brightly and Aeris saw the dark figure smile slowly, "You are doing a good thing Aeris. This will spare the world much pain, and I know you want these creatures to be at peace. It is the only way."

In a burst of light, Aeris was blinded for a moment. When her vision returns, Midgar is nothing but a toy with the towers stretching up to only her knees.

11121111.content:
Chaos was an understatement of the situation. Midgar was one of the most technologically advanced cities on the planet but none of its defenses or weaponry came close to helping stop Aerith's rampage. With a stoic cruel expression she just stomped everything in sight, crushing buildings to rubble, turning people into blood splatters on her soles, annilhating anything and everything. Many of the slums residents were confused, Aerith was well known for her flower shop; why would she suddenly grow and destroy all? The question haunted almost every one of them as Aerith's sole dug into their delicate bodies, finishing them off.

On the upper level of the Shinra Building Sephiroth chuckled, having entered from a hole Aerith made he watched as the giantess continued her onslaught. "What a fool." He laughed, he showed the girl images of her future yes, but a possible future not a definite one. All it took was those images and minor manipulation and the girl became an unwilling killing machine, little more than Sephiroth's gigantic pet. He particularly enjoyed the method she used to kill everyone, regular people were nothing but bugs compared to the Ancients, thus it is natural that they should be killed like them.

With a chuckle the swordsman turned away from the destruction and delved deeper into the building. "And at the end of it all, I'll finish off the girl... and then me and you can rule the world Mother, with no petty interferences." Sephiroth stopped in his steps, nearby he heard people yelling out orders, running, even shooting, and moments later a group of soldiers entered the room with the newly formed hole.

Sephiroth smirked as he turned back to them, the group saw him and instantly he felt the waves of fear come from them. They were speechless but their basic thoughts were obvious, "S-Sephiroth!!? H-He's dead!!"

The master warrior pulled out his Masamune, still smirking. "I have returned to rule this planet with Mother." He swung his sword once, and every single soldier who entered the room, all twelve of them, were sliced clean in two before they had enough time to even think of pulling the triggers on their guns. Sephiroth just laughed as their sliced bodies tumbled through the buildings opening, raining their fleshly deceased blood onto the city as the corpses fell.

Sword still unsheathed Sephiroth turned around and began walking again, he was on the Science Department floor, which meant his Mother would be nearby. More people littered his path, scientists, rogue experiments that escaped, soldiers, even members of SOLDIER, but Sephiroth decapitated them all before they even knew he was there. Soon he entered the main experimentation area, a large pod-like container was near, Sephiroth sensed the familiar presence within it. With another swing from Masamune the contained was destroyed, its cryogenetic ice and frost dissipating into the air. In the midst of the wires and destroyed contained was an alien-like humanoid, Jenova.

Sephiroth's eyes widened like he had stumbled upon the greatest treasure known to man, he stepped forwad, eagerly eyeing his Mother. "Mother...you're beautiful..." Jenova responded to his voice, convusling as it awakened to life once more. A voice rang out, it sounded almost godly as it seemed to come from nowhere. "Sephiroth...."

Images filled Sephiroth's mind as he stood before his mother, images of the destruction and carnage a gigantic woman like Aerith would reap. Junon, Gold Saucer, Wutai, every city was essentially wiped out, and the image of the one who caused it filled Sephiroth's mind next, the image had the gigantic Aerith with her stoic look but...there was another there too.

"I see....thank you Mother..." Sephiroth chuckled as the images vanished, "One is not enough. We need a second pawn to fully do the job." The swordsman extended a gloved hand to Jenova, the alien-like creature seemed to leapt into his grasp. "Together we will seek out this second pawn Mother. Someone who will obey us completely."

"W-Who are you?" A scared unknown voice rang out.

Together with his mother Sephiroth turned around, a woman had snuck into the room as he was having his heartfelt moment. His lips twisted into a mad smile, "Will this woman suffice Mother?" Jenova seemed to convulse in confirmation. Slowly Sephiroth walked towards the girl......
